result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M Addams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 03:35 PM Defendant Matthew M Addams in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard, telephonically. Tristan F Eagon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Woodard motioned to amend jail credit. DA Eagon objected. Rebuttal by Atty. Woodard. Statement by defendant. Discussion regarding Dane County case jail credit and time left over. Argument by DA Eagon. Statement by Atty. Woodard. Court granted 29 additional days jail credit. JOC to be amended.

03:07 PM Defendant Matthew M Addams in court, in custody with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received revocation order and warrant - no changes. DA Kohlwey noted probation on count 1 should have been 1 year, not 2 years. Court deemed time served on count 1. Sentencing statements. Court imposed 12 months jail, commencing forthwith. Huber granted under jail rules for work and verified treatment. May transfer to Dane County Jail. Unpaid court-ordered financials converted to civil judgment; restitution to be paid first. 191 days jail credit.
